title: I'm not even offended when people say kys.(kay why ess)
body:
If anyone says it in my games, I report them just so they get banned. I do it just to spite them, especially when they are talking shit. Even when they ARE talking shit, I report them and hope they get banned. It's not that I'm offended. if I'm winning the game and someone on the opposite team is tilted says something after my jg has camped them. I report them just so they can get banned. Any swearing at all, I'll try to report them. 

What I hope for, is that the forums and riot keep getting support tickets constantly in hopes that this will be changed. Specifically, the severe penalties.

** I HAVE NEVER EVER** played a game where you could be permed from shit talking. 
The one thing every other game prioritises over everything and anything else is third party programs. Any detection at all and that's a straight up perm. What the fuck is going on Riot? You guys are the fucking worst for detecting third party programs. But hey it's alright because it's putting money in your pocket right? Don't give me that bullshit "it's harder to detect third party programs blahblahblah". It's too fucking obvious.

I'll continue to report everyone for no reason hoping they get banned and I hope it kills your player base lol. You don't need me reporting people for that to happen, I think you're doing a good job of it yourself. /rant

replies.body: Lol. Welcome to the internet bro.

If you don't agree with the rules of the community you don't have to be a part of it. There's no obligation for you to play this game, just as Riot have no obligation to punish to your individual standards or anyone else's. Ultimately the players decide what gets punished by what they've chosen to report over the lifetime of the automated system. 

Clearly you have different standards which is fine, but at a point you have to make a choice. Either accept the rules of the community as they are and continue to play, refuse them and face the consequences, or just tap out all together.

>Ultimately the players decide what gets punished by what they've chosen to report over the lifetime of the automated system.

.

>just as Riot have no obligation to punish to your individual standards or anyone else's.

The irony is you hit the nail on the head and didn't realize the contradiction here.

The players don't decide, Riot does.

Riot decides to let the players decide the details. Obviously some things are going to be decided by Riot like harsher punishments for certain language. Allowing hate speech isn't a good look for anyone and shouldn't be allowed in public spaces no matter how many people try to claim 'banter'.

>Riot decides to let the players decide the details.

.

>just as Riot have no obligation to punish to your individual standards or anyone else's.

~~Player Choice~~

One individual does not make community consensus.

That would be like saying, just as an example, that all asians are toxic because the vocal ones harass others. You know, just as a random comparison off the top of my head.

You need a lot more than a few "linguistically neutral" individuals on an online place of discussion to say that something is a community consensus withing a video game.

>You need a lot more than a few "linguistically neutral" individuals on an online place of discussion to say that something is a community consensus withing a video game.

And yet, the Emissaries say that constantly.

Thank you for proving my point.

Just because Riot isn't obliged to punish to on random individuals standards doesn't mean they don't consider the majority opinion.

You are twisting words to suit your opinion, and assuming an absolute when I offered no such thing. Don't expect anyone to take that as proof of anything.

> [{quoted}](name=Seras Dragon,realm=OCE,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=P1Fk1sOi,comment-id=000200000000000000000000,timestamp=2018-02-13T03:22:44.497+0000)

Oh you mean sort of how riot does when they give you one side of a chat log and their report system taking things out of context? Yeah funny idea that.

They only give you one side precisely for players like you. Reflect on your own behaviour and what you did wrong, and let the reports decide if the other person deserved it just as they did for you, instead of deflecting your own negativity because "they started it" or "they engaged in it" or "they played bad".

The thing is simply this.

How do you decide what is wanted by the majority, and not by simply the individual reporting?

Tribunal is one way, but other then that, you can't actually tell what is wanted by the majority, and is simply the individual desires of players.

You keep saying majority, but i don't see how you can get a majority of player opinions, in a game that is capped at 10 players, unless somehow someone managed to get 1 million reports in that one game.

Not to mention, a report on a player, doesn't actually indicate which behaviour was the issue, as it is all done post game, so you could be willing to report because he said the word %%%%, but he got worse later, and now the word %%%% is ok, because there is worse things in the report.

Never can an algorithm do this fucking job, because an algorithm can't tell between what is right and wrong at all again, because reports based on one thing, can easily be construed as a report on another.

Fuck you can report someone for doing poorly (as people tend to do), but the bot might detect it as an issue with a word he said, nothing to stop it doing so.

Because what reason does Riot have to punish by the minority vote? Whereas they have plenty of reasons to punish by the majority, if for nothing else, profit. 

If you were to allow racism in game because  'it's just banter' you piss off a whole lotta people. A whole lotta people who are going to associate Riot with 'racism is ok' and therefore not spend money.

If you were to ban people for being bad at the game, no new player is going to be around for long. Less money.

If you allow people to be assholes in game with no repercussion, long term players become short term players. Less money.

Tribunal did not work. Majority of punishments issued by tribunal required manual review and adjustment because they were too harsh (something which you have said many times you are against mind you). People were using it as a means to vent, not to actually improve the game. You can't expect it to magically work this time.

There's a lot more info behind the scenes than just "did this person get reported yes or no".

If you can show me more than one recent punishment in who knows how many or so that was falsely issued then please do so, because as far as I can see the system is working as intended and working well. False punishments are few and far between and more often than not are handled very quickly or proved to be lying or omitting details.

Why would the collective playerbase think that racism or homophobia or 'kys' is ok to say to random strangers on the internet? Please do enlighten me.

>Because what reason does Riot have to punish by the minority vote? Whereas they have plenty of reasons to punish by the majority, if for nothing else, profit.

No, profit comes from no punishments, but a belief that the system works, whether it does or not.

>Tribunal did not work. Majority of punishments issued by tribunal required manual review and adjustment because they were too harsh (something which you have said many times you are against mind you). People were using it as a means to vent, not to actually improve the game. You can't expect it to magically work this time.

And yet this system can do it perfectly?

That's the issue with these contradictory statements, if this system DOESN'T require manual review, how is it that you can't setup tribunal to also not have manual review?

I'd argue if Tribunal didn't work, you can't expect some algorithm to magically work, and yet, that is what you tell me to believe while also telling me that tribunal can't work.

>Why would the collective playerbase think that racism or homophobia or 'kys' is ok to say to random strangers on the internet? Please do enlighten me.

Is this what i have been saying?

Again, ignoring the fact that a 14 day instant ban is overkill for anything said in chat.

I'm not saying that all of these behaviours are ok, i'm saying that it's not a "majority" deciding, it's Riot deciding, your own logic even backs that up, and not only that, you still are yet to give me a reason this algorithm is magically perfect and why that can't be turned and put into the tribunal.
couldn't have done that one better myself.

Geez, is your name Ethvn or 'Negative Nancy'.

I'm no Riot fan these days, but direct your anger where it is due.

Your concern is about the smallest issues with LoL, when the real problem(s) doesn't concern you at all.

You just don't know what's wrong and what's right. Contrary to what riot employees will believe "it's ok when it's banter" I know for a fact you can still catch yourself a ban even when it is banter i.e calling your duo a dumb%%%% in chat that you know irl and duo with all the time. But hey, it musn't be banter seeing as that's how riot deems it. Riot knows everything and Riot is always right, right? Lol

The thing you're missing completely, though, is that there's a big difference between banter and what is considered harassment. The example you provided can easily be considered harassment. Done in a private setting, or a situation where no one present will be offended, or take issue, is different than doing so in a public setting where one or more individuals will be offended or take issue.

Seems to me like you can't "read the room", so to say. It's a pretty basic skill from what I understand, and I'd say I'm relatively good at it in situations like LoL, considering I've never been punished and never had someone tell me that they didn't like what I've said. Not to say no one has ever taken issue, but if they have I've never known about it and it's never caused any repercussions.

Considering that social skills is an innate weakness of mine, it certainly says something about you if you're incapable of "reading the room" and adjusting the extent of your behaviour and attitude to the individuals you're interacting with, doesn't it?

>The thing you're missing completely, though, is that there's a big difference between banter and what is considered harassment.

I mean, anything can be considered as either, it depends on the person it is said to, hell you say this yourself.

>Done in a private setting, or a situation where no one present will be offended, or take issue

But we are playing with random players, yet you say that your banter is ok, even though there is the possibility it could have offended someone.

Do you see the issue with the justifications on both sides?

Everything can be banter, everything can be offensive, that's why we need a proper input, and not an input that is only based on one side of the opinion (everything can be offensive.)
Yeah I don't know why you bothered when I've it made it pretty clear that I'm accepting the fact you can be reported over bullshit, and that's what I'm going to exploit. lol

And exactly what "bullshit" are you referring to? Personally, I've never abused or harassed another player in LoL (or any game, from memory), but that doesn't mean I haven't occasionally indulged myself by engaging in banter and use of profanity.

Seems to me you're just b!tching because you got caught.

>but that doesn't mean I haven't occasionally indulged myself by engaging in banter and use of profanity.

You realise even that is now walking the line of being banned right?

Shit get unlucky and you'll find the new word they added to the insta-14 day ban list.
